name: rive
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to cut something apart with great force: It may thus be seen that the riving of the heart by the sword symbolises the final rupture of Daughter from Mother.
to divide people: Such conclusions have begun a debate that has increasingly riven archaeologists. See also
riven
More examplesFewer examplesBrutus hath riven my heart.But already news of the majority's wishes has rived the district.The hatreds that rive the small band of women MPs have to be experienced to be believed.The controversy about Blackwater has riven the community's social fabric.
